channel.title: DJ Decks
channel.description: I'm looking to buy some DJ Decks but have absolutely no idea what I should be looking for, and I was wondering if anyone here had any knowledge of the brands/prices for a decent set for a beginner. If anyone could give me any info, point me in the direction of a useful site or provide any info theirselves it would be greatly appreciated!

item.title: DJ Decks
item.dc:creator: @eVokki1 Cowie`
item.description:
@eVokki1 wrote:

Go with Trance or Dance that has a distinguished bass or drum sound - I know it sounds gay but genres with a lot of similar beats e.g 4x4 bassline are easy to match just due to the fact everyone uses the same “WARP”.

They dont have to be perfectly matched cuz you can speed up or slow down the beat with pc.

Read full topic

item.title: DJ Decks
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

I got myself a hold of a decent deal with a guy who was moving back home to Australia who was selling some entry level gear for cheap. I have myself two Gemini CDJ 203’s, a Numark DM950 mixer, a large Kenwood amp with Sub/Speakers. Now I’ve been messing with them for a little bit now, but I am starting to wonder how I start learning properly? Do I just keep trying to beat match properly, and keep trying to get a mix in?

What type of music is best to practice on? I’ve read that some trance with heavy bass beats is good to learn to beat match properly. I used to drum for 4-5 years, so i’m pretty happy with beat matching (obviously I need a shit load of practice on it, but most of the fundamentals are there).

Thanks guise.

Read full topic

item.title: DJ Decks
item.dc:creator: @eVokki1 Cowie`
item.description:
@eVokki1 wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:9, topic:355004”]youll need headphones obivously, but you can make do with any old pieces of shit until you get some more dough

i cant give any recommendations on cd decks im 'fraid, never used them

edit: the equivalent to the technics sl-1210 in the cd world is the pioneer cdjs, but theyre outside your budget by a fucking massive amount :P[/quote]

tbh you can pick up some HPS’s for like 30 or 35 quid and they’ll last until you go buy yourself a nice pair of HD380’s!

Read full topic

item.title: DJ Decks
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

youll need headphones obivously, but you can make do with any old pieces of shit until you get some more dough

i cant give any recommendations on cd decks im 'fraid, never used them

edit: the equivalent to the technics sl-1210 in the cd world is the pioneer cdjs, but theyre outside your budget by a fucking massive amount

oh and in case it wasnt obivous, belt-drive and direct-drive only apply to vinyl turntables

item.title: DJ Decks
item.dc:creator: @eVokki1 Cowie`
item.description:
@eVokki1 wrote:

Hurts me to know you’re going CD but if this is what you’re wanting then go with Gemini for CD - Their CDX series series are probably best value for money.

p.s looked on decks and they sell CDX2400 + C3 package so check it.

Read full topic

item.title: DJ Decks
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

It’ll be CD i’m afraid. I would fucking love to have vinyl, but it’s just another expense. The more digital for me, the better.

Those technics are way ahead of my budget - I’m looking to spend around <£500 on the lot if I can sell my PC, otherwise it will be <£300 :/. I’ve been looking through the the popular brands, and seen some really nice stuff. I’m a bit confused as to what I should go for. I’ve seen controllers that are just linked up to a PC, and everything is done through software linked to the hardware, and there’s also the CD decks which also look pretty cool which is also what I’d prefer.

I think there’s some nice Gemini’s and Numark’s I’m interested in, but any reccomendations would be great. I’ve heard from a mate that American Audio are another good brand for decks.

What else am I going to need? I guess I’ll get some decent self powered speakers, but apart from that, is there anything else that I’m going to need to consider in my budget.

Cheers for all the help so far Can’t wait to get myself some decks!

Edit - www.decks.co.uk seem to have some nice CD/Mp3 packages for some okay prices, I think. What do you all think, anything there particularly good?

Anyone have any thoughts on Numark NDX200’s? I think I might get a pair of these, and then get a decent mixer.

Read full topic

item.title: DJ Decks
item.dc:creator: @eVokki1 Cowie`
item.description:
@eVokki1 wrote:

I am shocked at the deck reccomendations par the ones Mopman suggests, altho even on a tight budget i’d never reccomend belt driven.

Read full topic

item.title: DJ Decks
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

yes, you probably do want direct rather than belt drive

direct drive decks have the motor coupled directly to the platter, belt drives have a belt connecting the two. belts slip if you put too much pressure on them, they get worn out, they generally dont have much torque, etc. youll end up having to compensate for this by doing shit like giving the record a little nudge when you drop it to get it up to speed… theres a school of thought that if you can get good on belt drives you can spin on anything, but uh, tbh just save yourself the hassle and get direct straight off

also if you wanna scratch ever you wont be doing that on belt drives or youll go crazy

if you can afford it you cant really go wrong with technics sl-1210s obivously, even second hand would be fine if you can make sure theyre not fucked, since they’ll probably outlast you, they’re solid as and basically the gold standard deck, theyll also resell fairly well if you look after them

if you need somethign a bit lower budget then the usual suspects are fine, gemini numark etc.
ask a dj friend if you can though for specific models, i havent bought decks in ages

edit: it makes me sad that ollie assumed you were going cd, there was a time when everyone would assume wax unless stated otherwise

edit2: you should probably specify cd or vinyl since im not sure anymore

edit3: if your budget is really really REALLY tight and you absolutely must get belt drives, then its not like you wont be able to spin on them, but you will be selling them on fairly quickly (at a big loss) if you decide you wanna stick with it, be warned

Read full topic

item.title: DJ Decks
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

The Vestax looks reeaal nice, but slightly on the expensive side. I’ve seen a lot of Numark, and they mostly look nice and more in my price range.

What sort of features should a decent set have? Just gotta try and justify a £300-400 purchase when I should be saving for Uni in a months time

nonono davidude

edit - I’ve read that I should mainly be looking at direct drive decks rather than belt drive? Why is this and what is the different between the two?

Read full topic

item.title: DJ Decks
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

i quite like the vestax vci-300, as a midi controller with two decks on it its amazing, good to take to partys and stuff too. quite mobile.

but numark are good, though if you ever want to get far, you have to go pioneer

prices vary from 300 to as much as you want to spend
